title: Taylor Swift, Camila Cabello, Lizzo unite for 2019 We Can Survive gig
text:
Taylor Swift, Lizzo and Camila Cabello on stage at the We Can Survive concert (Picture: Getty)

Now this is what you call a lineup! Taylor Swift, Camila Cabello and Lizzo all performed at the same charity event in LA, California on Saturday.

In fact, they were only some of the famous names at the star-studded 2019 We Can Survive concert, which reads like a who’s who of the world’s biggest female names in pop.

Tough Guy singer Billie Eilish was another huge name at the gig at the Hollywood Bowl.

Becky G, The Jonas Brothers and Marshmello completed the impressive lineup.

For each ticket sold for the Radio.com event, $2 (£1.50) went to breast cancer research.

Taylor also performed Blank Space and Shake It Off at the event (Picture: Getty Images North America)

We’re guessing it was a sell out!

Headliner Taylor performed five songs during her set, including three from her recent album, Lover: the title track, ME! and You Need to Calm Down.

Billie also appeared at the fundraiser (Picture: Getty Images North America)

Advertisement

Advertisement

Camilla, meanwhile, performed seven songs, including her blockbuster hit Havana and new songs Easy and Liar, while Billie performed 10, including When The Party’s Over and Bury A Friend.

Lizzo performed seven songs, including the recent Billboard Hot 100 Truth Hurts – which has recently been the subject of two plagiarism claims.

Camila looked sensational at the concert (Picture: Getty Images North America)

The song recently became the longest-running solo female rapper number-one single in history. The previous record-holder was Cardi B for Bodak Yellow.

The We Can Survive line up was certainly a great reflection of the current US charts.

Lizzo wore trousers emblazoned with her song lyric ‘100% that b**ch’ for her set (Picture: Getty Images North America)

Billie’s When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? and Taylor’s Lover are both currently in the top 10 of the albums chart.

Meanwhile, Camila, Lizzo and Billie all have singles in the top 10 of the Billboard Hot 100.

description: Billie Eilish and the Jonas Brothers also joined Taylor Swift, Camila Cabello and Lizzo for 2019 We Can Survive concert in LA yesterday.
